name: Banking Regulations P1 (Main)
description:
This law establishes banking and financial institution regulations for the Federal Bank. This law is part 1 of 3 - all 3 should be utilized together. The Minister of Finance has oversight and authority over the Federal Bank Matters. The MoF sets the interest rates. All interest rates are variable and subject to change. Individual aspects of this law are not guaranteed if not implemented by the Minister of Finance.

To Implement:
1) Create the following currencies, you will need 9 Mints: Savings Note, High Yield Savings Note, General Bond, Educational Bond, Meteor Protection Bond, Cultural Bond, Infrastructural Bond, Loan Notes, and Credit Score.
2) Create the following bank accounts: Federal Bank Main Account, Federal Bank Interest Rates, Bond Tracker, and Bond Repayment.
3) The Interest rates are controlled by sending the desired daily percentage rate of the additional currencies (except the Credit Score) to the "Federal Bank Interest Rates" account.
4) This law uses the currency exchange, which handles the savings, high yield savings, loans, and bonds - these should move in and out of the Federal Bank Main Account. Duplicates can be placed in towns or countries at the request of the local authority. The exchange must be on a federal claim stake owned by the Minister of Finance.
5) Various attributes of this law can be adjusted and should be reviewed by Parliament prior to passing. 

Credit: Author: Valfreya, Based on idea by SirDoder, Testers: Nuura, Weylin, PandaDono

properties.Title: [B] Federal Bank Interest Rates and Payments (Savings, Bonds, and Loans)
properties.UserDescription: This article provides the interest rates and interest payments for the Federal Banks operations. The actual interest rates are determined and set by the Minister of Finance.

properties.Title: [B] Setting Federal Bank Account Protections
properties.UserDescription: This article prevents transfers to the setting account(s) used in Article 2, the Federal Bank Main Account, and the tracking accounts.

properties.Title: [B] Record the Loan Amount
properties.UserDescription:
This article records the loan amount when the citizen exchanges their credit line for euros, the loan debt is record in Loan Note currency. The maximum loan amount is determined by the credit line.

Due to the way currency exchange interacts with companies, the currencies utilized in this article remain with the employee. The euros will be moved to the legal person's account according to the private property ban.

Target.contextDescription: The citizen who transfered the money. Note: Can only be taxed if they are a citizen of the settlement of the law executing.

properties.Title: [B] Manual Loan Repayment
properties.UserDescription: This article allows manual repayment of the loan by turning Loan Notes into Credit Score at the currency exchange. The appropriate payment and interest is charged to the citizen (or legal person in the case of a company) upon transfer. Note: Interest is always paid in full.

properties.Title: [B] Automatic Loan Repayment
properties.UserDescription:
This article processes automatic loan payments for citizens. Interest is always paid in full. The loan balance is paid according to minimum payments. This article also reconciles the accounting of the loan balance and the credit line.

Parliamentry Values:
Minimum Payment (flat): 250
Minimum Payment (percent): 5%
Interval of Payments: 24 hours

properties.Title: [B] Loan Abandonment
properties.UserDescription: This article recoups the entire amount of the loan if the player is about to go abandoned. The point of loan abandonment is considered 6 days and 20 hours (164 hours). Per the constitution, the Minister of Finance has an obligation to recoup outstanding debts. As this law does not work on abandoned individuals, the loan must be recouped before abandonment.

properties.Title: [B] Bank Reconcilation and Cleanup
properties.UserDescription: Return spare Exchange Notes to the bank. These currencies are only used to support currency transfers and hold no value. Citizens do not need to hold on to these notes and returning them to the bank make them available to other users.

Citizen.contextDescription: The citizen currently being processed for the timer event.
The citizen currently being processed for the timer event.

Target.contextDescription: The citizen currently being processed for the timer event.

properties.Title: [B] Exchange Note for Companies
properties.UserDescription: This article provides an alternate note for companies to participate in the bond market. The currency exchange machine doesn't allow company members to pick bank accounts and company members are not allowed to have euroes in their personal wallets. Exchange Note currency is used as a go-between currency. It is summoned at will from the bank, used in the exchange, and charged euroes equivalent via tax in the following article. This method is only available for company employees - non-company citizens should use the normal currency exchange.

Citizen.contextDescription: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: [B] Exchange Charge for Companies
properties.UserDescription: This article is a work-around for company participation in the currency exchange. Company employees have no euroes in their wallet due to the private property ban, and the currency exchange doesn't let you select the bank account to use. This article charges the appropriate euroes for the exchange currency used.

Citizen.contextDescription: The citizen who transfered the money. Note: Can only be taxed if they are a citizen of the settlement of the law executing.

properties.Title: High Yield Savings
properties.UserDescription:
This article converts Savings Notes to High Yield Savings Notes when the citizen reaches a threshold amount and vice versa.

Parliamentry Value:
Threshold of conversion: 25,000

properties.Title: Establishing Credit Score
properties.UserDescription:
This article establishes credit score distribution as a flat rate. The credit score determines the maximum loan amount that can be withdrawn from the bank. Additional credit can be requested from the MoF.

Parliamentry Notes:
Timer: once per day
Amount: 700 Euro

Citizen.contextDescription: The citizen currently being processed for the timer event.
